action_plan.tooltip_sea_turtles: Your plastic reduction measured in sea turtle weights. An average sea turtle weighs about 140kg (308 lbs), providing a powerful visualization of your impact on marine life.
action_plan.tooltip_microplastics: Number of microplastic particles prevented from entering our oceans. Each gram of plastic can break down into approximately 1,000 microplastic particles that harm marine ecosystems and enter the food chain.
action_plan.tooltip_dolphins: Your plastic reduction measured in dolphin weights. An average dolphin weighs about 180kg (397 lbs), showing the scale of ocean plastic pollution you're preventing.
action_plan.tooltip_co2_prevented: Carbon dioxide emissions prevented by reducing plastic production. Producing 1kg of plastic generates approximately 6kg of COâ‚‚ emissions through the extraction and manufacturing process.
action_plan.tooltip_oil_saved: Fossil fuel oil conserved by avoiding plastic production. About 2kg (approximately 2 liters) of oil is needed to produce 1kg of plastic, making plastic reduction a direct way to conserve petroleum resources.
action_plan.tooltip_tons_prevented: Total plastic waste prevented measured in metric tons (1,000 kg). This shows the cumulative weight of all plastic items your school commits to reducing annually.
